I have done this and have some recomendations:
1) I adapted the nozzle to a standard quick disconnect for my air compressor. This has a multi purpose, the nozzle doesn't melt, you can fill without any other mods, and the cone affect is combated.
2) I omitted the lighter strapped to the side as all you have to do is wet the nozzle with gas and light.
3) Repeated use will result in break down of the seals due to chemical compatibility and eventually it will leak resulting in catastrophic failure, and I burnt half my hair off!

It's a powder extinguisher, you don't have to spray it empty, just DON'T break the pressure seal (the first button you have to push) and screw the head off the bottle. The driving gas is in the small canister, while the powder compartiment is NOT pressurized...
That's why this type of extinguisher is refillable...

The problem with you fire breather theory on the lamp oil is that, when we breathe, we try to spread the oil out widely, more like your fire extinguisher was in the beginning and less like a solid stream. Better dispersal means more surface area and more air, making the lamp oil easy to light. When shot as a stream, the momentary heat of the lighter isn't enough to get that bulk of lamp oil to ignite.
